member.name: M:ImageResizer.ImageJob.ResolveTemplatedPath(System.String,ImageResizer.Util.PathUtils.VariableResolverCallback)
member.summary: Internal use only. Resolves the specified (potenetially templated) path into a physical path. Applies the AddFileExtension setting using the 'ext' variable. Supplies the guid, settings.*, filename, path, and originalExt variables. The resolver method should supply 'ext', 'width', and 'height' (all of which refer to the final image). If AllowDestinationPathVariables=False, only AddFileExtenson will be processed.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ImageJob.RequestedInfo

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ImageJob.ResultInfo
member.summary: A dictionary of key/value pairs provided along with the result.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ImageJob.Source
member.summary: The source image's physical path, app-relative virtual path, or a Stream, byte array, Bitmap, VirtualFile, IVirtualFile, HttpPostedFile, or HttpPostedFileBase instance.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ImageJob.Dest

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ImageJob.SourceHeight

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ImageJob.ResultMimeType

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ImageJob.Settings
member.summary: The image processing settings

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ImageJob.Instructions
member.summary: The image processing instructions

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ImageJob.DisposeSourceObject
member.summary: If true, and if 'source' is a IDisposable instead like Bitmap or Stream instance, it will be disposed after it has been used. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ImageJob.ResetSourceStream
member.summary: If true, and if 'source' is seekable, the stream will be reset to its previous position after being read. Always true for HttpPostedFile(Base) instances, defaults to false for all others.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ImageJob.DisposeDestinationStream
member.summary: If true, and if 'dest' is a Stream instance, it will be disposed after the image has been written. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ImageJob.FinalPath
member.summary: Contains the final physical path to the image (if 'dest' was a path - null otherwise)

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ImageJob.SourcePathData
member.summary: If 'source' contains any path-related data, it is copied into this member for use by format detetction code, so decoding can be optimized. May be a physical or virtual path, or just a file name.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ImageJob.AddFileExtension
member.summary: If true, the appropriate extension for the encoding format will be added to the destination path, and the result will be stored in FinalPath in physical path form.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ImageJob.AllowDestinationPathVariables
member.summary: If true (the default), destination paths can include variables that are expanded during the image build process. Ex. Dest = "~/folder/<guid>.<ext>" will expand to "C:\WWW\App\folder\1ddadaadaddaa75da75ad34ad33da3a.jpg".

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ImageJob.CreateParentDirectory
member.summary: Defaults to false. When true, the parent directory of the destination filename will be created if it doesn't already exist.

member.name: T:ImageResizer.Instructions
member.summary: A name/value collection of image processsing instructions. The successor to ResizeSettings. Just because a key doesn't have a property wrapper doesn't mean you can't use it. i["key"] = value; isnt' that scary.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Instructions.ToString
member.summary: Returns a human-friendly representation of the instruction set. Not suitable for URL usage; use ToQueryString() for that.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Instructions.ToQueryString
member.summary: Returns a URL-safe querystring containing the instruction set

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Instructions.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an empty instructions collection.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Instructions.#ctor(System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)
member.summary: Copies the specified collection into a new Instructions instance.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Instructions.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Parses the specified querystring into name/value pairs. Supports standard and semicolon syntaxes. The most readable format is 'key=value;key2=value2' Discards everything after the first '#' character as a URL fragment.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.Width
member.summary: The width in pixels to constrain the image to. See 'Mode' and 'Scale' for constraint logic.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.Height
member.summary: The height in pixels to constrain the image to. See 'Mode' and 'Scale' for constraint logic.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.Mode
member.summary: The fit mode to use when both Width and Height are specified. Defaults to Pad.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.Anchor
member.summary: The alignment to use when cropping or padding the image automatically. Defaults to MiddleCenter.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.SourceFlip
member.summary: Flip instruction to perform immediately after loading source image. Maps to 'sflip' and 'sourceFlip'.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.FinalFlip
member.summary: Flip instruction to perform after rendering is complete

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.Scale
member.summary: Control how upscaling is performed. Defaults to DownscaleOnly.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.Cache
member.summary: Allows disk caching to be forced or prevented.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.Process
member.summary: Allows processing to be forced or prevented.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.Frame
member.summary: The frame of the animated GIF to display. 1-based

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.Page
member.summary: The page of the TIFF file to display. 1-based

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.JpegQuality
member.summary: Determines Jpeg encoding quality. Maps to 'quality' setting.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.JpegSubsampling
member.summary: Maps to 'subsampling'. Requires encoder=wic|freeimage or builder=wic|freeimage to take effect. Not supported by the GDI pipeline.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.PaletteSize
member.summary: Maps to 'colors'. Sets the palette size for the final png or gif image (not relevant for jpegs). Set to 'null' to use the largest palette size available in the format. Requires the PrettyGifs or WicEncoder plugin.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.Zoom
member.summary: A multiplier to apply to all sizing settings (still obeys Scale=down, though). Useful when you need to apply a page-wide scaling factor, such as for mobile devices.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.CropXUnits
member.summary: Defines the horizontal width of the crop rectangle's coordinate space. For example, setting this to 100 makes the crop X1 and X2 values percentages of the image width.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.CropYUnits
member.summary: Defines the vertical height of the crop rectangle's coordinate space. For example, setting this to 100 makes the crop Y1 and Y1 values percentages of the image height.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.CropRectange
member.summary: An X1,Y1,X2,Y2 array of coordinates. Unless CropXUnits and CropYUnits are specified, these are in the coordinate space of the original image.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.CropRectangle
member.summary: An X1,Y1,X2,Y2 array of coordinates. Unless CropXUnits and CropYUnits are specified, these are in the coordinate space of the original image.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.AutoRotate
member.summary: Automatically rotates images based on gravity sensor data embedded in Exif. Requires the AutoRotate plugin

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.SourceRotate
member.summary: Maps to 'srotate'. Rotates the source image prior to processing. Only 90 degree angles are currently supported.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.Rotate
member.summary: Maps to 'rotate'. Rotates the image during rendering. Arbitrary angles are supported.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.Format
member.summary: Use 'OutputFormat' unless you need a custom value. Determines the format and encoding of the output image.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.OutputFormat
member.summary: Selects the image encoding format. Maps to 'format'. Returns null if the format is unspecified or if it isn't defined in the enumeration.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.IgnoreICC
member.summary: If true, the ICC profile will be discared instead of being evaluated server side (which typically causes inconsistent and unexpected effects).

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.FallbackImage
member.summary: The fallback image to redirect to if the original image doesn't exist. Must be the name of a pre-defined 404 image or a filename in the default 404 images directory. Requires the Image404 plugin to be installed.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.BackgroundColor
member.summary: The color of margin and padding regions. Defaults to Transparent, or White (when jpeg is the selected output color).

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.PaddingColor
member.summary: Defaults to 'bgcolor'. Allows a separate color to be used for padding areas vs. margins.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.BorderColor
member.summary: The color to draw the border with, if a border width is specified.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.Preset
member.summary: The name of a pre-defined preset, or a comma-delimited list of presets to apply. These may overwrite other settings. Requires the Presets plugin.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.Watermark
member.summary: The name of a pre-defined watermark layer or group from Web.config, or a comma-delimited list of names. Requires the Watermark plugin.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.Invert
member.summary: Applies a Negative filter to the image. Requires the SimpleFilters plugin

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.Sepia
member.summary: Applies a Sepia filter to the image. Requires the SimpleFilters plugin

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.Grayscale
member.summary: Applies the specified kind of grayscale filter to the image. Requires the SimpleFilters plugin

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.Alpha
member.summary: Value between 0 and 1. Makes the rendered image transparent. Does not affect borders or background colors - those accept 4-byte colors with alpha channels, however. Requires the SimpleFilters plugin. Unless the output format is PNG, the image will be blended against white or the background color.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.Brightness
member.summary: -1..1 Adjust the brightness of the image. Requires the SimpleFilters plugin

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.Contrast
member.summary: -1..1 Adjust the contrast of the image. Requires the SimpleFilters plugin

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.Saturation
member.summary: -1..1 Adjust the saturation of the image. Requires the SimpleFilters plugin

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.TrimThreshold
member.summary: Setting this enables automatic whitespace trimming using an energy function. 50 is safe, even 255 rarely cuts anything off except a shadow. Set TrimPadding to pad the result slightly and improve appearance. Requires the WhitespaceTrimmer plugin.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.TrimPadding
member.summary: Set TrimThreshold first. This specifies a percentage of the image size to 'add' to the crop rectangle. Setting to 0.5 or 1 usually produces good results. Requires the WhitespaceTrimmer plugin.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.Blur
member.summary: Guassian Blur. Requires the AdvancedFilters plugin.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.Sharpen
member.summary: Unsharp Mask. Requires the AdvancedFilters plugin.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.RemoveNoise
member.summary: Safe noise removal. Requires the AdvancedFilters plugin.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.Dither
member.summary: Controls dithering when rendering to an 8-bit PNG or GIF image. Requires PrettyGifs or WicEncoder. Accepted values for PrettyGifs: true|false|4pass|30|50|79|[percentage]. Accepted values for WicEncoder: true|false.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.Encoder
member.summary: Specify a preferred encoder for compressing the output image file. Defaults to 'gdi'. Other valid values are 'freeimage' and 'wic', which require the FreeImageEncoder and WicEncoder plugins respectively. FreeImage offers faster jpeg encoding, while WIC offers faster PNG and GIF encoding. Both, however, require full trust.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.Decoder
member.summary: Specify a preferred decoder for parsing the original image file. Defaults to 'gdi'. Other values include 'freeimage', 'wic', and 'psdreader'. The preferred decoder gets the first chance at reading the files. If that fails, all other decoders try, in order of declaration in Web.config. Requires the matching FreeImageDecoder, WicDecoder, or PsdReader plugin to be installed.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.Builder
member.summary: Specify the image processing pipeline to use. Defaults to 'gdi'. If FreeImageBuilder or WicBuilder is installed, you can specify 'freeimage' or 'wic' to use that pipeline instead. The WIC pipeline offers a 2-8X performance increase of GDI, at the expense of slightly reduced image quality, the full trust requirement, and support for only basic resize and crop commands. FreeImage offers *nix-level image support, and handles many images that gdi and wic can't deal with. It is also restricted to a subset of the full command series.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.RoundCorners
member.summary: Gets or sets a 1 or 4-element array defining cornder radii. If the array is 1 element, it applies to all corners. If it is 4 elements, each corner gets an individual radius. Values are percentages of the image width or height, whichever is smaller. Requires the SimpleFilters plugin.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.Padding
member.summary: ["paddingWidth"]: Gets/sets the width(s) of padding inside the image border.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.Margin
member.summary: ["margin"]: Gets/sets the width(s) of the margin outside the image border and effects.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Instructions.Border
member.summary: Friendly get/set accessor for the ["borderWidth"] value. Returns null when unspecified.

member.name: T:ImageResizer.Resizing.BuilderExtension
member.summary: Provides a useable base class that can be used to modify the behavior of ImageBuilder. When registered with an ImageBuilder instance, the ImageBuilder will call the corresponding methods on the extension prior to executing its own methods.

member.name: T:ImageResizer.Resizing.AbstractImageProcessor
member.summary: Not for external use. Inherit from BuilderExtension instead. Dual-purpose base class for both ImageBuilder and BuilderExtension Extensions can inherit and override certain methods. ImageBuilder inherits this method to utilize its extension invocation code. Each method of AbstractImageProcessor loops through all extensions and executes the same method on each. Provides a sort of multiple-inheritance mechanisim.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Resizing.AbstractImageProcessor.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new AbstractImageProcessor with no extensions

member.summary: Extend this to allow additional types of source objects to be accepted by transforming them into Stream instances. First plugin to return a Stream wins.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Resizing.AbstractImageProcessor.DecodeStreamFailed(System.IO.Stream,ImageResizer.ResizeSettings,System.String)
member.summary: Extensions are executed until one extension returns a non-null value. This is taken to mean that the error has been resolved. Extensions should not throw an exception unless they wish to cause subsequent extensions to not execute. If extensions throw an ArgumentException or ExternalException, it will be wrapped in an ImageCorruptedException instance. If the Bitmap class is used for decoding, read gdi-bugs.txt and make sure you set b.Tag to new BitmapTag(optionalPath,stream);

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Resizing.AbstractImageProcessor.DecodeStream(System.IO.Stream,ImageResizer.ResizeSettings,System.String)
member.summary: Extend this to support alternate image source formats. If the Bitmap class is used for decoding, read gdi-bugs.txt and make sure you set b.Tag to new BitmapTag(optionalPath,stream);

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Resizing.AbstractImageProcessor.PostDecodeStream(System.Drawing.Bitmap@,ImageResizer.ResizeSettings)
member.summary: Extend this to modify the Bitmap instance after it has been decoded by DecodeStream or DecodeStreamFailed

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Resizing.AbstractImageProcessor.PreAcquireStream(System.Object@,ImageResizer.ResizeSettings)
member.summary: Extend this to allow additional types of *destination* objects to be accepted by transforming them into a stream.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Resizing.AbstractImageProcessor.BuildJob(ImageResizer.ImageJob)
member.summary: The method to override if you want to replace the entire pipeline. All Build() calls call this method first. Does nothing in ImageBuilder

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Resizing.AbstractImageProcessor.buildToStream(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.IO.Stream,ImageResizer.ResizeSettings)
member.summary:
Called for Build() calls that want the result encoded. (Not for Bitmap Build(source,settings) calls. Only override this method if you need to replace the behavior of image encoding and image processing together, such as adding support for resizing multi-page TIFF files or animated GIFs.
Does NOT dispose of 'source' or 'source's underlying stream.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Resizing.AbstractImageProcessor.buildToBitmap(System.Drawing.Bitmap,ImageResizer.ResizeSettings,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Most calls funnel through here. Default behavior configures an ImageState instance and calls Process(imageState); Shouldn't be overriden for any reason I can think of - use the appropriate virtual method under Process(). If an extension returns a Bitmap instance, it will be used instead of the default behavior. Does NOT dispose of 'source' or 'source's underlying stream.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Resizing.AbstractImageProcessor.OnProcess(ImageResizer.Resizing.ImageState)
member.summary: Process.0 First step of the Process() method. Can replace the entire Process method if RequestAction.Cancel is returned. Can be used to add points to translate (for image maps), and also to modify the settings

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Resizing.AbstractImageProcessor.PrepareSourceBitmap(ImageResizer.Resizing.ImageState)

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Resizing.AbstractImageProcessor.PostPrepareSourceBitmap(ImageResizer.Resizing.ImageState)

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Resizing.AbstractImageProcessor.FlipExistingPoints(ImageResizer.Resizing.ImageState)
member.summary: Process.3(Layout).1: This is where the points in the layout are flipped the same way the source bitmap was flipped (unless their flags specify otherwise)

member.summary: Process.3(Layout).2: Rings 'image' and 'imageArea' are added to the layout.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Resizing.AbstractImageProcessor.PostLayoutImage(ImageResizer.Resizing.ImageState)
member.summary: Process.3(Layout).3: Add rings here to insert them between the image area and the padding

member.name: T:ImageResizer.Plugins.Basic.IEPngFix
member.summary: Causes IE6 and earlier to use GIF versions of PNG files. By default, only fixes requests with ?iefix=true in the querystring. When catchall is enabled, it will filter all png images, unless iefix=false on those requests. Not compatible with CDNs or proxy servers, as they do not allow varying by user agent reliably.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.Basic.IEPngFix.DestFormatPng(ImageResizer.Configuration.IUrlEventArgs)
member.summary: Returns true if the specified querystring and file will cause a PNG file to be returned.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Plugins.Basic.IEPngFix.NeedsPngFix(System.Web.HttpContext)
member.summary: Returns true if the user agent string specifies MSIE versions 1 through 6 for Windows. Cached in context.Items after first call.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.Basic.IEPngFix.CatchAll
member.summary: If true, 'iefix=true' will be the default for all PNG images, instead of 'iefix=false'.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.Basic.IEPngFix.Redirect
member.summary: If true, the requests from IE will be HTTP redirected to new URLs. If false, the GIF will be silently served instead of the PNG, without any redirection. A CDN or caching proxy will mess things up regardless, but using redirection ensures that the CDN/proxy never caches the GIF version instead of the PNG.

member.name: T:ImageResizer.Plugins.Basic.ImageHandlerSyntax
member.summary: Adds URL syntax support for legacy projects: http://webimageresizer.codeplex.com/, http://imagehandler.codeplex.com/, http://bbimagehandler.codeplex.com/, DAMP: http://our.umbraco.org/projects/backoffice-extensions/digibiz-advanced-media-picker, Support for http://bip.codeplex.com/ and http://dynamicimageprocess.codeplex.com/ urls is default since w/h are supported.

member.name: T:ImageResizer.Plugins.Basic.Image404
member.summary: Redirects image 404 errors to a querystring-specified server-local location, while maintaining querystring values so layout isn't disrupted. For example, missingimage.jpg?404=image.jpg&width=200 with the default setting <image404 baseDir="~/" /> will redirect to ~/image.jpg?width=200. You may also configure 'variables', which is the reccomended approach. Ex. <image404 propertyImageDefault="~/images/nophoto.png" /> and use them like so: missingimage.jpg?404=propertImageDefault?width=200 -> ~/images/nophoto.png?width=200. Querystring values in the variable value take precedence. For example, Ex. <image404 propertyImageDefault="~/images/nophoto.png?format=png" /> and missingimage.jpg?format=jpg&404=propertImageDefault?width=200 -> ~/images/nophoto.png?format=png&width=200.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Configuration.PipelineConfig.SkipFileTypeCheck
member.summary: Get or sets whether the file extension check should be applied to the current request. Defaults to true. If set to true, will only affect the current request, and will only cause the Resizer to evaluate the rewriting rules on the request. Processing may still not occur if no querystring values are specified. Add 'cache=always' to force caching to occur.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Configuration.PipelineConfig.IsHandlingRequest
member.summary: Returns true if the current request is being processed and/or cached by the pipeline. Will return false until *after* the FileExists method is called on the VirtualPathProviders, which is after the AuthorizeImage event fires. This will return a usable value if used from VirtualFile.Open(), or if used inside the PreHandleImage event or later.

member.name: E:ImageResizer.Configuration.PipelineConfig.OnFirstRequest
member.summary: Fired once, on the first PostAuthorizeRequest event.

member.name: E:ImageResizer.Configuration.PipelineConfig.PostAuthorizeRequestStart
member.summary: Fires during the PostAuthorizeRequest phase, prior to any module-specific logic. Executes for every request to the website. Use only as a last resort. Other events occur only for image requests, and thus have lower overhead.

member.name: E:ImageResizer.Configuration.PipelineConfig.Rewrite
member.summary:
Fired during PostAuthorizeRequest, after ResizeExtension has been removed. On fired on requests with extensions that match supported image types.
You can add additonal supported image extentions by registering a plugin that implementes IQuerystringPlugin, or you can add an extra extension in the URL and remove it here. Example: .psd.jpg

member.name: E:ImageResizer.Configuration.PipelineConfig.RewriteDefaults
member.summary:
Fired during PostAuthorizeRequest, after Rewrite. Any changes made here (which conflict) will be overwritten by the the current querystring values. I.e, this is a good place to specify default settings.
Only fired on accepted image types. (see Rewrite)

member.name: E:ImageResizer.Configuration.PipelineConfig.PostRewrite
member.summary:
Fired after all other rewrite events.
Only fired on accepted image types. (see Rewrite)

member.name: E:ImageResizer.Configuration.PipelineConfig.AuthorizeImage
member.summary: Fired after all rewriting is finished. e.AllowAccess defaults to the result of the UrlAuthorization module's verdict. It can be changed. Set e.AllowAccess to true to cause and 403 Access Dened result.

member.name: E:ImageResizer.Configuration.PipelineConfig.ImageMissing

member.summary: Searches all loaded assemblies for the specified type, applying rules and prefixes to resolve the namespace and assembly. Returns null if it could not find the type, and logs an issue.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Configuration.PluginConfig.remove_plugin(System.Object)
member.summary: For use only by plugins during .Uninstall. Removes the specified plugin from AllPlugins, QuerystringPlugins, CachingSystems, ImageEncoders, and ImageBuiderExtensions, based on which interfaces the instance implements. Plugins may register event handlers and modify settings - thus you should use the plugin's method to uninstall them vs. using this method.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Configuration.PluginConfig.add_plugin(ImageResizer.Plugins.IPlugin)
member.summary: Only for use by plugins during IPlugin.Install. Call Plugin.Install instead of this method, since plugins often must perform other initialization actions. Adds the specified plugin to AllPlugins, QuerystringPlugins, CachingSystems, ImageEncoders, and ImageBuiderExtensions, based on which interfaces the instance implements. For ICache and IEncoder, the plugin is inserted at the beginning of CachingSystems and ImageEncoders respectively. To reiterate, plugins may register event handlers and modify settings - thus you should use the plugin's method to uninstall them vs. using this method. Will not register a plugin that is already installed, unless it implementes IMultiInstancePlugin.

member.name: T:ImageResizer.Collections.SafeList`1
member.summary: SafeList is mutable, but it uses immutable data structures to minimize the need for locking. The provided manipulation Exposes a immutable list. Changes are made by copying the lists. SafeList is Never perform logic on SafeList directly, always use GetList() or GetCollection() first, followed by SetList(). If you need involved list-fu, use ModifyList and specify a callback. It will execute inside a lock, preventing changes on other threads from overwriting each other.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Collections.SafeList`1.GetCollection
member.summary: Returns an immutable snapshot of the collection

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Collections.SafeList`1.SetList(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0})
member.summary: Replaces the current collection with a new one. (copied to ensure safety) Use ModifyList when modifying the list. Use this only when the previous or current state of the list is irrelevant.

member.summary: Adds the specified item to the end of the list

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Collections.SafeList`1.Remove(`0)
member.summary: Removes the item from the list

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Collections.SafeList`1.AddFirst(`0)
member.summary: Adds the specified item to the beginning of the list

member.summary: Allows a caller to perform logic on the list inside a lock, and return a modified list. Callbacks should be fast, and should reference the IList they are fed, not this SafeList instance. Calling methods on the SafeList instance will cause a deadlock.

member.summary: When to process and re-encode the file.

member.name: F:ImageResizer.ProcessWhen.No
member.summary: Request no processing of the image or file (generally used with cache=always). The file contents will be used as-is.

member.summary: Require the file or image to be processed. Will cause non-image files to fail with an ImageCorruptedException.

member.name: T:ImageResizer.ScaleMode
member.summary: Controls whether the image is allowed to upscale, downscale, both, or if only the canvas gets to be upscaled.

member.name: F:ImageResizer.ScaleMode.DownscaleOnly
member.summary: The default. Only downsamples images - never enlarges. If an image is smaller than 'width' and 'height', the image coordinates are used instead.

member.name: F:ImageResizer.ScaleMode.UpscaleOnly
member.summary: Only upscales (zooms) images - never downsamples except to meet web.config restrictions. If an image is larger than 'width' and 'height', the image coordinates are used instead.

member.name: F:ImageResizer.ScaleMode.Both
member.summary: Upscales and downscales images according to 'width' and 'height', within web.config restrictions.

member.name: F:ImageResizer.ScaleMode.UpscaleCanvas
member.summary: When the image is smaller than the requested size, padding is added instead of stretching the image

member.name: T:ImageResizer.StretchMode
member.summary: [Deprecated (Use FitMode.Stretch)] Previously used to force an image to be 'stretched' to match a different aspect ratio.

member.name: F:ImageResizer.StretchMode.Proportionally
member.summary: [Deprecated (Use FitMode)] Maintains aspect ratio. Default.

member.name: F:ImageResizer.StretchMode.Fill
member.summary: [Deprecated (Use FitMode)] Skews image to fit the new aspect ratio defined by 'width' and 'height'

member.name: T:ImageResizer.FitMode
member.summary: How to resolve aspect ratio differences between the requested size and the original image's size.

member.name: F:ImageResizer.FitMode.None
member.summary: Fit mode will be determined by other settings, such as &carve=true, &stretch=fill, and &crop=auto. If none are specified and width/height are specified , &mode=pad will be used. If maxwidth/maxheight are used, &mode=max will be used.

member.name: F:ImageResizer.FitMode.Max
member.summary: Width and height are considered maximum values. The resulting image may be smaller to maintain its aspect ratio. The image may also be smaller if the source image is smaller

member.name: F:ImageResizer.FitMode.Pad
member.summary: Width and height are considered exact values - padding is used if there is an aspect ratio difference. Use &anchor to override the MiddleCenter default.

member.name: F:ImageResizer.FitMode.Crop
member.summary: Width and height are considered exact values - cropping is used if there is an aspect ratio difference. Use &anchor to override the MiddleCenter default.

member.name: F:ImageResizer.FitMode.Carve
member.summary: Width and height are considered exact values - seam carving is used if there is an aspect ratio difference. Requires the SeamCarving plugin to be installed, otherwise behaves like 'pad'.

member.name: F:ImageResizer.FitMode.Stretch
member.summary: Width and height are considered exact values - if there is an aspect ratio difference, the image is stretched.

member.name: F:ImageResizer.CropMode.None
member.summary: Default. No cropping - uses letterboxing if strecth=proportionally and both width and height are specified.

member.name: F:ImageResizer.CropMode.Auto
member.summary: [Deprecated] Use Mode=Crop. Minimally crops to preserve aspect ratio if stretch=proportionally.

member.name: F:ImageResizer.CropMode.Custom
member.summary: Crops using the custom crop rectangle. Letterboxes if stretch=proportionally and both widht and height are specified.

member.name: F:ImageResizer.CropUnits.SourcePixels
member.summary: Indicates the crop units are pixels on the original image.

member.name: F:ImageResizer.CropUnits.Custom
member.summary: Indicates a custom range is being specified for the values. Base 0.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.ImageBuilder.LoadImage(System.Object,ImageResizer.ResizeSettings)
member.summary: Loads a Bitmap from the specified source. If a filename is available, it will be attached to bitmap.Tag in a BitmapTag instance. The Bitmap.Tag.Path value may be a virtual, relative, UNC, windows, or unix path. Does not dispose 'source' if it is a Stream or Image instance - that's the responsibility of the calling code.
member.param: May be an instance of string, VirtualFile, IVirtualFile IVirtualBitmapFile, HttpPostedFile, Bitmap, Image, or Stream. If passed an Image instance, the image will be cloned, which will cause metadata, indexed state, and any additional frames to be lost. Accepts physical paths and application relative paths. (C:\... and ~/path)
Will ignore ICC profile if ?ignoreicc=true.
member.returns: A Bitmap. The .Tag property will include a BitmapTag instance. If .Tag.Source is not null, remember to dispose it when you dispose the Bitmap.

member.name: T:ImageResizer.InterceptModule
member.summary: Monitors incoming image requests to determine if resizing (or other processing) is being requested.

member.summary: Called when the app is initialized

member.name: M:ImageResizer.InterceptModule.CheckRequest_PostAuthorizeRequest(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: This is where we filter requests and intercept those that want resizing performed. We first strip FakeExtension, then verify the remaining file extension is supported for decoding. We fire URL rewriting events. If the result includes any supported querystring params afterwards, we process the request. Otherwise we let it fall back to IIS/ASP.NET. If the file doesn't exist, we also ignore the request. They're going to cause a 404 anyway.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.InterceptModule.HandleRequest(System.Web.HttpContext,System.String,System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection,ImageResizer.Plugins.IVirtualFile)
member.summary: Generates the resized image to disk (if needed), then rewrites the request to that location. Perform 404 checking before calling this method. Assumes file exists. Called during PostAuthorizeRequest

member.name: M:ImageResizer.InterceptModule.context_PreSendRequestHeaders(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: We don't actually send the data - but we still want to control the headers on the data. PreSendRequestHeaders allows us to change the content-type and cache headers at excatly the last

member.name: P:ImageResizer.InterceptModule.conf

member.name: T:ImageResizer.ImageProcessingException
member.summary: Represents an non-recoverable exception that occured while processing the image. Possible causes are: a corrupted source file, cache resource timeout (such as a locked file in imagecache), unusable configuration (for example, no registered encoders or caches), invalid syntax, or a size limit was exceeded and the request was stopped by the SizeLimiting extension. May also be caused by a missing source file/resource, in the form of the ImageMissingException subclass.

member.name: T:ImageResizer.Plugins.Basic.SizeLimits
member.summary: Enforces two kinds of maximum size constraints: a Total size limit, and an Image size limit. Image limits do not include padding, border, or effect widths, and automatically shrink the 'width/height/maxwidth/maxheight' values to fit within the limits. Total limits are absolute and apply to the actual result dimensions, causing an exception if they are exceeded. Limits are checked during the layout phase, prior to resource-intensive bitmap operations.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.Basic.SizeLimits.TotalSize
member.summary: The maximum final size an image generated by ImageBuilder can be. Defaults to 3200x3200

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.Basic.SizeLimits.TotalBehavior
member.summary: What action to take when the total size of the final image would exceed the TotalSize value. Defaults to ThowException

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.Basic.SizeLimits.HasImageSize
member.summary: Returns true if ImageSize is specified.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.Plugins.Basic.SizeLimits.ImageSize
member.summary: The maximum size an un-rotated image can be drawn when creating a resized image. Rotation will increase the total size, as will any borders, paddings, margins, or effects. Not effective at preventing attacks, use totalSize. If larger values are specified in a querystring, they will automatically be scaled to fit within these dimensions. Defaults to 0x0, which means no limits

member.name: T:ImageResizer.Util.PathUtils
member.summary: A set of utility methods for manipulating virtual paths

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Util.PathUtils.SetExtension(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Should be called SetFullExtension. Sets the file extension of the specified path to the specified value, returning the result. If an extension has multiple parts, it will replace all of them. Leading dots will be stripped from 'newExtension' and re-addd as required. The querystring and fragment is maintained as-is. Semicolon syntax not supported.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Util.PathUtils.RemoveFullExtension(System.String)
member.summary: Removes all extension segments from the filename or URL, leaving the querystring intact. I.e, image.jpg.bmp.tiff?hi would be image?hi The querystring and fragment is maintained as-is. Semicolon syntax not supported.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Util.PathUtils.RemoveExtension(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the extension from the filename or URL, leaving the querystring intact, where the extension is only the last extension segment. I.e, image.jpg.bmp.tiff?hi would be image.jpg.bmp?hi after this call. The querystring and fragment is maintained as-is. Semicolon syntax not supported.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Util.PathUtils.AddExtension(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds the specified extension to path, returning the result. Multiple calls will result in "path.ext.ext.ext.ext". The querystring and fragment is maintained as-is. Semicolon syntax not supported.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Util.PathUtils.GetFullExtension(System.String)
member.summary: Will return the full extension, like ".jpg.ashx", not just the last bit. Excludes extensions containing spaces or slashes. The querystring and fragment is ignored. Semicolon syntax not supported.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Util.PathUtils.GetExtension(System.String)
member.summary: Grabs the last segment of the filename extension. Returns an empty string if there is no extension, or if the extension contains a space. Includes the leading '.' The querystring and fragment is ignored. Semicolon syntax not supported.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Util.PathUtils.ResolveAppRelative(System.String)
member.summary: Resolves app-relative paths to virtual paths. Does nothing with virtual or relative paths.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Util.PathUtils.ResolveAppRelativeAssumeAppRelative(System.String)
member.summary: Turns relative paths into domain-relative paths. Turns app-relative paths into domain relative paths.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Util.PathUtils.AddQueryString(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Joins the path and querystring. If the path already contains a querystring, they are 'append joined' with the correct character. Fragment is maintained as-is. Does not support the semicolon syntax.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Util.PathUtils.RemoveQueryString(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the query string from the specifed path. If the path is only a querystring, an empty string is returned. Does not support the semicolon syntax. Fragment is maintained as-is.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Util.PathUtils.MergeOverwriteQueryString(System.String,System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)
member.summary: Overwrites exisisting querystring values in 'path' with the values in 'newQuerystring'. Does not support the semicolon syntax.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Util.PathUtils.MergeQueryString(System.String,System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)
member.summary: Adds the querystring values in 'newQuerystring' to the querystring in Path, but does not overwrite values. Does not support the semicolon syntax.

member.summary: Returns a string querystring in the form "?key=value&key=value". Keys and values are UrlEncoded as they should be.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Util.PathUtils.BuildQueryString(System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a string querystring in the form "?key=value&key=value". Keys and values are UrlEncoded if urlEncode=true.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Util.PathUtils.BuildSemicolonQueryString(System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a string querystring in the form ";key=value;key=value". Keys and values are UrlEncoded if urlEncode=true.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Util.PathUtils.BuildQueryString(System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Char,System.Char,System.Char)
member.summary: Build a customized querystring from a NameValueCollection
member.param: True to URL encode all values
If true, null-valued keys will be skipped
Usually ? or ;
Usually & or ;
Always =

member.summary: Attempts to guess the virtual path from physical path. Will be thrwarted if the path is mapped as a virtual folder inside the application. member.summary: Replaces variables in paths with their values. Ex. ~/uploads/thumbs/<guid>.<ext>. Standard variables are <ext> (the default extension for the final file type), <guid>, a randomly generated GUID, <filename>, the original filename without it's extension, <path>, the original path and filename without extension, <settings.width>, (any specified settings value except preset), <width> (final width), and <height> (final height).

Returns an array of parallelograms. These parallelgrams are the 'corners' outside each vertex in 'poly'. The adjacent edges are perpendicular to 'poly'. Point 1 of each parallelogram will match the respective point in 'poly' Points are clockwise.

The height y1 and y2 are relative to
The size of the uncropped image

member.name: T:ImageResizer.ResizeSettings
member.summary: Represents the settings which will be used to process the image. Extends NameValueCollection to provide friendly property names for commonly used settings. Replaced by the Instructions class. Will be removed in V4.0

member.name: M:ImageResizer.ResizeSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an empty settings collection.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.ResizeSettings.#ctor(System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)
member.summary: Copies the specified collection into a new ResizeSettings instance.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.ResizeSettings.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Parses the specified querystring into name/value pairs. leading ? not required. Discards everything after the first '#' character as a URL fragment.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.ResizeSettings.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,ImageResizer.FitMode,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new resize settings object with the specified resizing settings
member.param: The desired image format, like 'jpg', 'gif', or 'png'. Leave null if you want to preserve the original format.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.ResizeSettings.WasOneSpecified(System.String[])
member.summary: Returns true if any of the specified keys are present in this NameValueCollection

member.name: M:ImageResizer.ResizeSettings.SetDefaultImageFormat(System.String)
member.summary: If 'thumbnail' and 'format' are not specified, sets 'format' to the specified value.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.ResizeSettings.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string containing all the settings in the class, in querystring form. Use ToStringEncoded() to get a URL-safe querystring. This method does not encode commas, spaces, etc.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.ResizeSettings.ToStringEncoded
member.summary: Returns a querystring with all the settings in this class. Querystring keys and values are URL encoded properly.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.ResizeSettings.Normalize
member.summary: This method will 'normalize' command aliases to the primary key name and resolve duplicates. w->width, h->height, sourceFlip->sFlip, thumbnail->format

member.name: M:ImageResizer.ResizeSettings.Normalize(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Normalizes a command that has two possible names. If either of the commands has a null or empty value, those keys are removed. If both the the primary and secondary are present, the secondary is removed. Otherwise, the secondary is renamed to the primary name.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ResizeSettings.Width
member.summary: ["width"]: Sets the desired width of the image. (minus padding, borders, margins, effects, and rotation). The only instance the resulting image will be smaller is if the original source image is smaller. Set Scale=Both to upscale these images and ensure the output always matches 'width' and 'height'. If both width and height are specified, the image will be 'letterboxed' to match the desired aspect ratio. Change the Mode property to adjust this behavior.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ResizeSettings.Height
member.summary: ["height"]: Sets the desired height of the image. (minus padding, borders, margins, effects, and rotation) The only instance the resulting image will be smaller is if the original source image is smaller. Set Scale=Both to upscale these images and ensure the output always matches 'width' and 'height'. If both width and height are specified, the image will be 'letterboxed' to match the desired aspect ratio. Change the Mode property to adjust this behavior.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ResizeSettings.MaxWidth
member.summary: ["maxwidth"]: Sets the maximum desired width of the image. (minus padding, borders, margins, effects, and rotation). The image may be smaller than this value to maintain aspect ratio when both maxwidth and maxheight are specified.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ResizeSettings.Quality
member.summary: ["quality"]: The jpeg encoding quality to use. (10..100). 90 is the default and best value, you should leave it.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ResizeSettings.MaxHeight
member.summary: ["maxheight"]: Sets the maximum desired height of the image. (minus padding, borders, margins, effects, and rotation). The image may be smaller than this value to maintain aspect ratio when both maxwidth and maxheight are specified.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ResizeSettings.Mode
member.summary: ["mode"]: Sets the fit mode for the image. max, min, pad, crop, carve, stretch

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ResizeSettings.Rotate
member.summary: ["rotate"] The degress to rotate the image clockwise. -360 to 360.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ResizeSettings.Anchor
member.summary: How to anchor the image when cropping or adding whitespace to meet sizing requirements.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ResizeSettings.Flip
member.summary: Allows you to flip the entire resulting image vertically, horizontally, or both. Rotation is not supported.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ResizeSettings.SourceFlip
member.summary: ["sFlip"] Allows you to flip the source image vertically, horizontally, or both. Rotation is not supported.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ResizeSettings.Scale
member.summary: ["scale"] Whether to downscale, upscale, upscale the canvas, or both upscale or downscale the image as needed. Defaults to DownscaleOnly. See the DefaultSettings plugin to adjust the default.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ResizeSettings.Stretch
member.summary: [Deprecated] (Replaced by mode=stretch) Whether to preserve aspect ratio or stretch to fill the bounds.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ResizeSettings.Cache
member.summary: ["cache"]: Server caching mode suggestion for the result

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ResizeSettings.Process
member.summary: ["process"]: Server processing suggestion for the result. Allows you to 'disable' processing of the image (so you can use disk caching with non-image files). Allows you to 'force' processing of the image, for images without a querystring.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ResizeSettings.CropMode
member.summary: ["crop"]=none|auto Defaults to None - letterboxing is used if both width and height are supplied, and stretch = proportionally. Set CropTopLeft and CropBottomRight when you need to specify a custom crop rectangle.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ResizeSettings.CropValues
member.summary: 4 values specify x1,y1,x2,y2 values for the crop rectangle. Negative values are relative to the bottom right - on a 100x100 picture, (10,10,90,90) is equivalent to (10,10,-10,-10). And (0,0,0,0) is equivalent to (0,0,100,100).

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ResizeSettings.CropTopLeft
member.summary: ["crop"]=([x1],[y1],x2,y2). Sets x1 and y21, the top-right corner of the crop rectangle. If 0 or greater, the coordinate is relative to the top-left corner of the image. If less than 0, the value is relative to the bottom-right corner. This allows for easy trimming: crop=(10,10,-10,-10). Set ["cropxunits"] and ["cropyunits"] to the width/height of the rectangle your coordinates are relative to, if different from the original image size.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ResizeSettings.CropBottomRight
member.summary: ["crop"]=(x1,y1,[x2],[y2]). Sets x2 and y2, the bottom-right corner of the crop rectangle. If 1 or greater, the coordinate is relative to the top-left corner of the image. If 0 or less, the value is relative to the bottom-right corner. This allows for easy trimming: crop=(10,10,-10,-10). Set ["cropxunits"] and ["cropyunits"] to the width/height of the rectangle your coordinates are relative to, if different from the original image size.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ResizeSettings.BackgroundColor
member.summary: ["bgcolor"]: Named and hex values are supported. (rgb and rgba, both 3, 6, and 8 digits).

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ResizeSettings.PaddingColor
member.summary: Gets/sets ["paddingColor"]. Named and hex values are supported. (rgb and rgba, both 3, 6, and 8 digits).

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ResizeSettings.Padding
member.summary: ["paddingWidth"]: Gets/sets the width(s) of padding inside the image border.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ResizeSettings.Margin
member.summary: ["margin"]: Gets/sets the width(s) of the margin outside the image border and effects.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ResizeSettings.BorderColor
member.summary: Gets/sets ["borderColor"]. Named and hex values are supported. (rgb and rgba, both 3, 6, and 8 digits).

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ResizeSettings.Border
member.summary: Friendly get/set accessor for the ["borderWidth"] value. Returns BoxPadding.Empty when unspecified.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ResizeSettings.Format
member.summary: Like this["format"]. Gets or sets the output file format to use. "png", "jpg", and "gif" are valid values. Returns null if unspecified. When format is not specified, the original format of the image is used (unless it is not a web safe format - jpeg is the fallback in that scenario). Also checks the 'thumbnail' value for V2 compatibility. When set, 'thumnail' is removed and only 'format' is used.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ResizeSettings.CropXUnits
member.summary: The width which the X and X2 crop values should be applied. For example, a value of '100' makes X and X2 percentages of the original image width. This can be set to any non-negative value. Very useful for performing cropping when the original image size is unknown. 0 indicates that the crop values are relative to the original size of the image.

member.name: P:ImageResizer.ResizeSettings.CropYUnits
member.summary: The width which the Y and Y2 crop values should be applied. For example, a value of '100' makes Y and Y2 percentages of the original image height. This can be set to any non-negative value. Very useful for performing cropping when the original image size is unknown. 0 indicates that the crop values are relative to the original size of the image.

member.summary: Copies a read stream to a write stream.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Util.StreamUtils.CopyToBytes(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Copies the remaining portion of the specified stream to a byte array of exact size.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Util.UrlHasher.hash(System.String,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Builds a key for the cached version, using the hashcode of the normalized URL. if subfolders > 1, dirSeparator will be used to separate the subfolder and the key. No extension is appended. I.e, a13514\124211ab132592 or 12412ababc12141

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Util.UrlHasher.getSubfolder(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a string for the subfolder name. The bits used are from the end of the hash - this should make the hashes in each directory more unique, and speed up performance (8.3 filename calculations are slow when lots of files share the same first 6 chars. Returns null if not configured. Rounds subfolders up to the nearest power of two.

member.name: M:ImageResizer.Util.Utils.parseList(System.String,System.Double)
member.summary: Parses lists in the form "3,4,5,2,5" and "(3,4,40,50)". If a number cannot be parsed (i.e, number 2 in "5,,2,3") defaultValue is used.
